skill.name: tdd-enforcer
skill.description: Use when implementing new features. Enforces TDD workflow - write tests FIRST, then implementation. Ensures AAA pattern, proper coverage, and quality test design.
skill.summary: Use when implementing new features. Enforces TDD workflow - write tests FIRST, then implementation. ...
skill.author: Barnhardt-Enterprises-Inc

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. This is a markdown documentation file providing TDD guidelines only.

content.value_statement: Writing tests after code leads to gaps in test coverage and fragile tests. This skill guides the TDD cycle with clear phases: Red (write failing tests), Green (minimal implementation), and Refactor (improve code while tests stay green).
actual_capabilities: Requires AAA pattern (Arrange, Act, Assert) in all tests
Validates test coverage thresholds (75% overall, 90% business logic)
Guides writing descriptive test names that describe behavior
Provides examples for unit, integration, and E2E tests
Ensures tests fail before implementation (Red phase verification)
limitations: Does not execute tests or verify coverage directly
Cannot access project files to analyze existing tests
Does not run test commands like npm test
Only provides guidance through prompts and examples

use_cases.title: Build Test Coverage
use_cases.description: Developers implementing new features use TDD to create comprehensive test suites before writing implementation code.

use_cases.title: Validate Test Quality
use_cases.description: Reviewers verify that pull requests follow TDD principles with properly structured AAA tests and adequate coverage.

use_cases.title: Learn TDD Practices
use_cases.description: Teams new to test-driven development follow the structured workflow to build test habits and write maintainable tests.

prompt_templates.title: Start TDD Session
prompt_templates.prompt: Use TDD workflow for this feature. First write failing tests that describe the expected behavior. Tests must use AAA pattern (Arrange, Act, Assert). Verify tests fail before writing implementation.

prompt_templates.title: Write Unit Tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Write unit tests for this service following TDD. Create tests using describe blocks organized by method. Include tests for edge cases, error conditions, and success paths. Use AAA pattern and descriptive test names.

prompt_templates.title: Verify Coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the test coverage requirements. Ensure business logic (src/services/) has 90%+ coverage, utilities have 90%+ coverage, and overall coverage is 75%+. Flag any code paths without test coverage.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor Safely
prompt_templates.prompt: With all tests passing, refactor the code for quality. Remove duplication, improve naming, and enhance readability. Do not change behavior. All tests must remain green throughout refactoring.

output_examples.input: Use TDD to implement user registration with email validation
output: Creating tests first with AAA pattern
Test: should reject invalid email formats (Red)
Test: should create user with hashed password (Red)
Test: should return 400 for missing fields (Red)
Writing minimal implementation to pass tests (Green)
Refactoring for clarity while tests stay green

best_practices: Always write failing tests before implementation to confirm the test catches the missing feature
Use AAA pattern consistently: Arrange (setup), Act (execute), Assert (verify) in every test
Keep tests focused on behavior, not implementation details, to make refactoring easier
anti_patterns: Writing implementation before tests (defeats the purpose of TDD)
Testing implementation details instead of observable behavior
Creating giant tests that cover too many scenarios in one test case

faq.question: What tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Provides guidance for any test framework.

faq.question: What coverage thresholds does it enforce?
faq.answer: 75% overall coverage required. Business logic and utilities require 90%+ coverage.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing code?
faq.answer: Yes. Apply TDD for new features. For legacy code, write tests before making changes.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides guidance. It does not access files or execute code.

faq.question: Why do tests need to fail first?
faq.answer: Failing tests confirm the test actually checks for the feature. If tests pass before implementation, they are not testing the right thing.

faq.question: How is this different from general testing advice?
faq.answer: This enforces the strict TDD cycle: Red (failing tests), Green (minimal code), Refactor. Many guides skip the discipline of writing failing tests first.
